website_summaries.verdict: Instead of a storage pouch, this chart includes a secondary board, making magnets easier to access.
pros: Made from dry erase boards connected with fabric hinges
Includes 90 magnets for chores, behavior, and tracking progress
Unused magnets stay attached to the secondary board instead of a pouch or packet
cons: The wooden frame warps relatively easily

customer_reviews.title: Get it NOW!!! Lol
customer_reviews.text: I absolute love these core charts. I took them apart and pained it to match my daughter's room. They love these charts as well. Hella keep them on track with their simple chores. I highly recommend this chore chart. By far the best one available
customer_reviews.author: Fatunla Family

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend buying
customer_reviews.text: The board looks awesome, but the wood warped over night while it was laying on my counter. We live in the north and still have the heat going, so this was an unpleasant surprise. The next day, we hung the board up. By morning, it was on the floor because the strap to hang it broke. I'm very disappointed in the quality of the product. I've bought tons of M&D toys over the years and this was definitely the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made, and poses not only a safety concern but a choking hazard for our children
customer_reviews.text: Super Poor Quality. This item is cheaply made, wood was rough and splintered. The boards themselves or the pieces were not sealed or painted causing them to detach. The paper on the magnets fell off several magnets after first use. This item was just put together in a hurry and is treat and safety to concern to all children. Any child could choke on these very easily if not supervise. I am very disappointed as I thought this company really stood by its products and made safe products for our children. Shame on you Melissa and Doug. We have several Melissa and Doug toys, and this will most likely be our last. Contacted seller and have not received a response
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Marie

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Product.
customer_reviews.text: This will change your kids behavior if you use it properly! We have 2 (for our boys, 4 and 6) and bought another for a friend. The kids look forward to their nightly evaluation and even think during the day "keep hands to myself" and other things on the chart. We can remind them "is that keeping your hands to yourself?" and they remember what will happen if they don't. They won't get to chose from the treasure box (which is filled with cheap toys). It is a positive way to reinforce positive behaviors. Brilliant product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MAGNETIC CHORE CHART
customer_reviews.text: This chore chart works great for younger kids. We are using it for an 11 year old that is educationally delayed so it works good for him. I liked having a couple of blank "boards" to write our own chores on--would like to see more of those and a double space on the top portion. But overall it's a nice chart and so easy to use. The kids can mark off their own chores.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Aller

customer_reviews.title: Unusually disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Normally we love and trust Melissa and Doug, but this product left us disappointed. At least five of the wooden circles fell off the magnetic backing when we simply opened the package and several more have fallen off since then (two days ago). I had to change the place we were going to hang this so our two year old wouldn't grab the magnetic discs but hung it because our four year old is so excited about the idea of earning acknowledgment (and to choose our weekend family movie for each week he completes the chart) that I couldn't refuse.
customer_reviews.author: M Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works for 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: This has helped us with our 5 year old's stubbornness, and I haven't had any warping issues. Some options are missing that I'd think would be standard (practice instrument comes to mind), and there is just barely enough room on the bottom board at the beginning of the week. Also, the magnets are really annoying to remove, but I don't see a way around that. Overall, we're using this, and I'm glad w bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Elan

customer_reviews.title: It's a great idea
customer_reviews.text: My son is very excited to start earning an allowance. I thought this was a great way to visually show him all his responsibilities. Two things I am not crazy about: the top insert in the wood, where you put the chores and tiles, is crooked! You can see where it should have been cut, and it all slants within the wooden frame. The other thing is I wish the two pieces weren't connected. I would have liked to have put them up next to each other instead of on top of each other.
customer_reviews.author: C. Slavin

customer_reviews.title: Great chart!
customer_reviews.text: We actually found one of these charts at a resale shop and after using it for a few days we loved it and ordered a second one so that both of our kids could have one. We have used hand-made charts in the past and it can be time consuming. I love that I can customize this chart to fit my individual kids goals. The list of tasks is appropriate and you can add your own. My kids also like using the chart and moving the magnets around when they complete a task. It is well made and built to last. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Countrymom10

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids to learn responsibilities, but some of the listed ones are not age appropriate for a school aged child. Some of them are also things done once a week or every other day. An every other day one wouldn't be hard to work around, and you could find ways to customize it for your kiddo. Overall we really like it and our child is engaged in using it and tracking herself.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad to see Melissa & Doug customer service takes care ...
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, my boards warped too. (So that explains too why the magnets kept falling!) I wish I had known about the issue and possibility of return. Unfortunately, this was at least a couple years ago now. I'm glad to see Melissa & Doug customer service takes care of their customers. FWIW, we have the M&D calendar board too and that hasn't warped at all while made in a very similar fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Our Needs
customer_reviews.text: We love this chore chart. It has a number of chores you can swap in and out (with magnets), and each one includes both the words and a picture so even our youngest can tell what each chore is. This also comes with plenty of circular magnets to keep track of progress throughout the week.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lake

customer_reviews.title: Great way to introduce kids on ways to help!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter who is almost 5 years old. She wanted to help with things around the house so we bought this. She loves to see the gratification of putting a smiley face on her chart when she completes something. We keep it positive and don’t force her to get all the spaces filled. Great idea to begin introducing “helping hands” into daily items.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great Chart
customer_reviews.text: Loved this chart!! It has many selections for responsibilities. We have been able to make it work for our six year old and 2.5 year old. The magnets are strong enough that the buttons do not fall off, it helps motivate the littles and is brightly colored.
customer_reviews.author: Hwelkley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice little product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice little product. I wish it had some magnets with different kind of smiley faces and sad faces. All of them are pretty much saying great job, super, but none of them say we didn't finish the job or anything like that. The product material is what you expect a pine board with a magnetic background other reviews said it was a cheap quality product I don't know if they were expecting it to be mahogany or Oak but it's a mass produced product. Overall I like it I might make a couple custom magnets just to say the job wasn't completed or some sad faces.
customer_reviews.author: william bucklin

customer_reviews.title: Your kids will beg to do chores
customer_reviews.text: We needed a system to encourage our daughter to complete her chores to earn TV time. The visual and manipulative aspect of the chart offer the type of simple feedback that she needs each day. She's so happy to see the magnets fill up her chart each week. NOTE: The chart is heavy and pulled a hook out of our concrete wall. We'll need to install an anchor to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher & Emily G.

customer_reviews.title: "responsibility chart" board was slightly warped but the magnets still ...
customer_reviews.text: "responsibility chart" board was slightly warped but the magnets still work. Helps motivate my 4 yr old and gives her an incentive. We use this our "chore responsibility chart" and also have a "good behavior" banner with the days of the week and two pins for each day. If she has 5 chores completed per day then she gets a coin & if she has 10/14 behavior pins at the end of the week then she gets to receive a prize she helps pick out (such as going to the red box to rent a movie). The combination of using daily "responsibility chart" and weekly "behavior pins" has helped improve her behaviors and give positive incentives.
customer_reviews.author: Janell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome board. My son loves this and it helps keep him in the right track and lets him kniw what he is struggling with. There's a little section to keep the magnets in order which was a huge plus. The board itself feels very sturdy and there's a little string to hang it from. Ours is in the kitchen. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Bionic Mind

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tool to get Children to Do Chores Etc.
customer_reviews.text: I developed my own behavior modification tactics when my grandson and son/daughter-in-law, were struggling with behavior problems at about age 3. However, while the system I came up with was highly successful then, as he got older, he needed to transition to more mature expectations. At about age 5, they implemented the Responsibility Chart which has worked amazingly well. The incentive for my grandson has always been rewards. For so many good deeds, he gets to chose a special activity, such as a family day at the park, or going swimming or to a hot springs or having pizza with the family.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept!
customer_reviews.text: I love the customization of this product. I love all the selections of jobs that are included and that it comes with a couple of blank ones to make your own. It is a really fun chart and my kids love putting the magnets on. (a little too much sometimes) The thing that I am disappointed with is that one of the boards has warped already and I have not had it long at all. It no longer hangs properly on the wall because it isn't flat any more. If it weren't for that, I would give it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: steveme4ever

customer_reviews.title: Great to teach on the daily basis
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to teach my son some responsibility and we did enjoy it very much, not excellent materials but durable and sturdy. It serves it's purpose and son is responding well to it. It's two boards in one we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nataly

customer_reviews.title: Special Needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to keep my 3 special needs boys on task...I 1st saw this at a thrift store & knew it would be perfect for them. I was soooooo happy to find that it came with 25 different tasks & 7 different colors, one for each day of the week...
customer_reviews.author: I. Brownlow

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and with adequate packaging. Magnets are well made and stick well. Our four year old has trouble pulling them off. Good for using one or multiple skills. You can write your own goals with the blank magnets. Purchase price was far below in store. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Lehman

customer_reviews.title: My favorite part is that the surface can be used as ...
customer_reviews.text: We have several special needs children in our family and these have been a life saver. We bought one for each child and use them every day. My favorite part is that the surface can be used as a white board so we use a dry erase marker with it. If they don't complete a task, we draw a frowny face. It's so clear that way. The pictures work really well with our autistic son. I am very pleased with the construction. I love that Amazon carries these because I went to many different stores looking for them only to leave empty handed. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: R & S

customer_reviews.title: Really love Melissa and Doug products for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: Really love Melissa and Doug products for my toddler. My only two complaints with this is that 1. The product has warped. It is in a playroom, not around moisture and it has warped pretty bad. 2. The tasks are geared more towards older children not a 3 year old. Luckily she cannot read yet so I just make it up according to what we set and she goes with it
customer_reviews.author: Amie B.

customer_reviews.title: great for teaching accountability and rewards
customer_reviews.text: This is a really convenient and understandable way to convey responsibility to kids. My kids naturally want to help out, and this chart makes their contributions seem more tangible. Things I like: -durable materials, sturdy magnets -categories have pictures so even preschoolers can participate -my kids are totally excited to add a magnet to the chart -comes with a few blank pieces to create your own category Things I wish: -that it could track more than one child more easily -that it had more achievements for younger kids instead of so many similar chores -that they had used the bottom half for something other than storing magnets
customer_reviews.author: mommyike

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, great item,  I highly recommend,
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this responsibility chart for my 4-year old, she spends a lot of time whining and not wanting to pick up her toys and not tidying up behind her self, So We decided to give this a try and it has been great tool so far. The chart provids positive reinforcement for all types of behaviors. I especially like the magnets that focus on problem behaviors such as hitting and whining and sharing. The chart is very durable, simple to use and understand, and very child focused. I recommend this chart to friends and family, it's a very good learning tool, thanks Melissa and Doug"!!
customer_reviews.author: Bestman

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this. Magnets are just strong enough so things are not falling off. Love the blank board below to hold everything not in use. I use the command picture hanging strips (kinda like velcro) to hang the top part. It does not budge. I see no reason if you don't want the bottom hanging part to move you can't do the same with the bottom part. The only thing I wish is it was slightly bigger to accommodate 2 kids. Once my youngest gets a bit older I am going to need to get a 2nd one for her.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaLH1234

customer_reviews.title: Kids are totally stoked!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kids (aged 5 and 8) were very excited to get these! We immediately set up the daily chores at the top of the board and discussed how this system would work. My 5-year-old realized that he hadn't brushed his teeth after lunch (we normally *don't* brush after lunch) and ran to the bathroom to give them a thorough scrubbing. He just couldn't wait to get his first smiley face! We've only had this a week, so we'll see how their enthusiasm holds. I gave it a 4 because it is really heavy and a little crowded. We hung them on studs using a molly bolt to make sure they don't pull out of the drywall.
customer_reviews.author: TellItLikeItIS

customer_reviews.title: Love this! We bought two
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We bought two, one for each of our kids and they are perfect! They are sturdy, the magnets hold well and the pictures make it easy for our oldest (who is autistic) to understand. It is colorful and fun and both of our children love visiting it often through the day. The flexibility of chore magnets not only give you lots of options but ideas too and the blank magnets can be customized with a dry erase marker to tailor it to your needs. I feel that this is something our family will use for a long time, keeping the kids motivated while teaching them about goals, money, etc. Definitely a good investment!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Lover

customer_reviews.title: Better than anticipated!
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited about the responsibility chart. My three year old daughter is going through her tenacious threes and driving everyone crazy. I hope this will help me grant her more structure, discipline, and a stronger more reliable routine.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to teach young kids about responsibility!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to use with young kids. I particularly appreciate that the chores vary in appropriateness from very young (3-ish; no whining) to much older (7-8; doing laundry/washing dishes). It also comes with a couple of blank chore magnets in case you feel you're missing any. My 4 year old, can read and understand the chart very well, and even looks forward to getting her "responsibility smiles" at the end of the day. Great product - excellent way to teach young kids about responsibility.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Needed to help a 2 1/2 year old with structure/rules/expectations...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't planning on buying this, but it is exactly what I need at exactly the right time. My 2 1/2 year old is struggling with his toddler two's and sharing mommytime with his 10 month old sister. He is very smart and likes knowing everything... this board came at the right time. We are using 5 expectations/responsibilities to keep it simple. "saying please/thank you; sharing; cleaning up toys; cleaning room; stop whining" He is good at two of them most of the time and another over half of the time... the sharing and stop whining are our target responsibilities. Hoping the other three success tasks will encourage him to work on the last two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for our 3year old who is super excited by the idea of earning her "tokens" each day. The bottom half seems like a lot of wasted space (I stored the unused tiles in a Ziploc baggie since i can easily see those getting scattered around the house) so i printed off a blank monthly calendar so she can cross off the days and see her schedule. I'm not sure if it's dry erase but I may eventually find a use for the bottom half or remove it altogether. Either way, it's still a cute product and seems to motivate her to go above and beyond her expected chores.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching responsibilities
customer_reviews.text: My son is 3yrs 4 months old and he loves his 'pons-bilities'. I love that there are different levels of responsibilities so that it's age-appropriate for different ages. I put things on there that he already does well (get dressed, brush teeth) and also things he needs to work on (stop whining (oh the whining! Make it stop!), put toys away), and he loves seeing how many smiley faces he gets for the day. He tells everyone about his smiley faces and reminding him of behavior as it relates to earning smileys has had a positive affect!
customer_reviews.author: AN Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not great for a 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had more blank ones to write on because half of the ones it comes with I can't apply to my 3 year old. Also the magnets aren't very strong, they fall off easily.
customer_reviews.author: miro

customer_reviews.title: Great chore chart for one child, ok for two
customer_reviews.text: This a good tool for tracking chores. It is colorful and fun and has lots of chore options. Both of my kids (7 and 5) really responded to the incentive of being able to show what they've done each day. However, it's not ideal for tracking two children. I'm almost wondering if I need to get a second one. There's not enough space to put two smiley faces on each day for the same task. (ex. only the older child has homework, but they both have to brush their teeth.) I store the unused magnets elsewhere and use a dry erase marker and a ruler to extend the chart onto the second white board.
customer_reviews.author: A. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We got this responsibility chart so my son could earn some money for taking care of age appropriate chores. I like that it is called a responsibility chart and not a chore chart. There are some responsibilities that are already printed on the magnets, As well as several blank magnets that can be written on with dry erase markers and then wiped clean. My son looks forward to adding up his circles to see how much money he gets at the end of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, one for each child. So far they are working out ok. Problem is keeping the kids motivated and in track. A few of the chore pieces are bowed but we weren't using those pieces anyways. Also I like the dry erase board part for one of my sons, but I don't need it for the other. So I do wish there was a way to detach it or velcro it to the back and have it out of the way. But overall we have been very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Hoosiermom

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son since he's getting to the age where he's doing daily chores. The chart is huge and heavier than I thought but it seems like it's built pretty well. We're hanging the board on a hallway door with large Command hooks. I wish the magnets were more about chores and less about behavioral problems or siblings and pets (neither of which my son has). My other issue is I just received this and already some of the stickers glued to the magnets are falling off. That's very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: my friend recommended a kind of responsibility chart and of course Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: seriously. my 3 year old is LOVING this. She was not behaving very well, time outs didn't seem to work. my friend recommended a kind of responsibility chart and of course Amazon has one and it's great! i love that it's positive reinforcement for my girl. she's already gotten her first reward for meeting our goal. and my husband threatened to take away a happy face because she was misbehaving and she straightened up right away. this product is great. i love Melissa and Doug products. it's easy to use and easy to explain, even to a 3 1/2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Mom13

customer_reviews.title: I haven't cleaned in a decade
customer_reviews.text: This chart has been so effective that I am now morbidly obese and bedridden. The kids keep on using this amazing chart.
customer_reviews.author: KJ Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tool for getting kids to do chores and learn responsibility!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this responsibility board!!! My son is 2 1/2 and has gotten very into putting his magnets up when he has accomplished a task. It also comes with 2 empty magnets so you can write your own tasks in, which is great. We make it a big deal if he gets all his magnets for a whole week and I've noticed that he's getting g much more into doing the things on the board, it's especially been a big help with potty training. Iblove Melissa & Doug products and this is no exception. Definitely more than worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for! My son has been wanting to start chores and he now makes sure he finishes them all each day! I also love that they give you 2 blank tiles!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Balfanz

customer_reviews.title: Well Made & Great Motivator
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy and well made and has really helped motivate my 9 year old daughter to do her chores and routines without me having to tell her repeatedly to do something.
customer_reviews.author: Josie's

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chore chart
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent responsibility chart that has gotten my kids motivated to help out. Not only does it teach them responsibility but rewards them with a smiley that they love to place on their chart when they accomplish their tasks. When my kids fill in a weeks worth of smiles then they turn them in for coins! This educational tool helps build self esteem and is a great positive reinforcement tool to get them to help out! There are several premade magnetic chores listed and a couple of blanks for you to make your own. This is a nicely constructed wood chart that is very durable and child friendly, I highly recommend this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Daley

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR my 4 Year old!!! Wonderful quality!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this board. My son has been non stop looking for ways to get smiles for his good behavior and chores around the house. I’ve seen such a change in 2 days in his eagerness to listen and mind his manners. So happy with this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Love this Responsibility Chart!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old son to get him excited about helping out around the house as well as teach him a little about working and getting an allowance. He absolutely loves it! He is excited about picking out his chores for the week and makes sure that he has all of his magnets put up for the day before bed. It is larger than I expected but we bought one of the larger command hooks and that seems to be working just fine. The quality is awesome and has withstood an average 4 year old boy so far with no issues. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Really great to teach responsibility!
customer_reviews.text: My son is six years old and he loves this chart. We hung it on his bedroom door and so far even with the opening and closing, it has held up. It’s very sturdy. There is a good variety of chores and a couple of blank ones for you to make your own.
customer_reviews.author: Kandice Hartman

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Its good. I usually make the charts out of paper, but I started to find that wasteful, because every week I'd have to print pages out. Even when I had a stack of them ready on hand for the next weeks, just felt wasteful with the paper. So I found this and purchased it. Its working, but it's geared more towards older kids (5+). My son is 3, and we only use a bit of the preselected options. But there is a white board as well as some magnets you can write your own chores on. My son just really digs the smiley faces. Everyday he chooses a different color to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa M

customer_reviews.title: Finally found something that worked
customer_reviews.text: We have had quite a bit of trouble getting my son to do chores. We tried sticker incentives and small gifts and money but he would lose interest on day 2 or 3. He is very excited about this and enjoys seeing all of his accomplishments. I allow him to select a few chores he would like to do that week and I add a few very simple ones that are "givens" so he can start to see the magnets add up and that makes him want to do more. I pay him 5 cents a magnet once a week. He is 5 years old and is very proud of himself for his accomplishments.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Simple Start to Good Behavior
customer_reviews.text: Seriously - Could Melissa & Doug toys get any better!? This chart is functional, simple, well-made, and simply a wonderful start to implementing childhood expectations. With bright colored, easy to read responsibilities paired with images this chart is appropriate for all ages. It takes into account both action and emotional/attitude resonsiblities which also make it unique from many other products on the market. Pair it with your own reward system or simply make counting the number of achievements it's own reward - we just can't say enough. Melissa & Doug have made learning and being a kid fun, yet again!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2-2

customer_reviews.title: This chart far exceeds anything else that is out there.
customer_reviews.text: I've searched around for different chore charts and I kept coming back to the Melissa & Doug Magnetic Responsibility Chart. This chart far exceeds anything else that is out there. The chart is durable and contains everything you need to get your child started. The magnets are easy to use and appealing to children. The chart comes with several chores already listed. However, they also include to white magnets so that you can fill in the blanks with a dry erase marker. In addition to being easy to use, the chart is easy to hang. My son couldn't wait to start using his new chart.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are 3 & 4 and they LOVE this chart! They are literally excited to get a magnet so doing the items listed is actually rewarding for them! We used the blank magnets to say 'Stop Saying No' and "No Yelling'.. :D If they get the majority of their magnets they get to play 1 hour of their tablet on Saturday. So that is enough incentive for them! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amber Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My son has fun picking his chores/behavior goals for the week and then crossing them off daily. In order to fit 2 children on this chart I attached a bag to the bottom back to store all the reward pieces and I use the top section for 1 kid and the bottom section for the other. I could use some blank ones so we could fill in whatever chore we wanted...for now I just write on the clear plastic that came with it. We'll see how long that lasts
customer_reviews.author: WalkOn

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but wood is warped.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and the concept is well executed. My daughter is excited to do chores to get a magnet on the chart. Oh the power of positive reinforcement! I am deducting a star because the wood is warped. As many other reviewers have noted, the board does not lie flat. It isn't an issue for me given how we've hung it, but it is quite disappointing. Even more so given that Melissa and Doug usually means high quality. Well, it used to ...
customer_reviews.author: KAN

customer_reviews.title: looks great
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, i just need to find somewhere to hang it. It would be nice if they had included more blank ones. I love the amount of options for chores, should be handy for a number of years.
customer_reviews.author: Sho

customer_reviews.title: Great item for my grandkids.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these after reading the reviews. One for each of my two granddaughters. My daughter said the girls were very excited about it and wanted to start it right away. My daughter was impressed with the fact that it had not only chores to do but how to behave also. She said she would alternate different ones each week. The reviews helped me in deciding to get this so I thought I would add another good review. They also got them really fast. I have used Amazon for years and always been impressed with what I ordered. If I had a problem, they always resolved it.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: bigger size
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chart and it is working so far. I do wish it was a bit bigger and had more pre-spaced lines.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Nothing for negative feedback?
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that I don't really like about it is that it doesn't come with "work on it" or "do better" or something negative if they didn't complete the responsibility for the day... all the smiley things say positive things. I guess you're just not supposed to give them one if they don't do a good job that day or something...I am all for positive feedback, but no negative feedback?
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Eh..its okay
customer_reviews.text: We modified it. The smiley faces dont do anything for my 3 yr old. We added 5, 10, 15 minutes on the magnets to teach chores= time for favorite things. The set up is not the best, but got us started at least.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6 year olds who hate chores!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this responsibility chart. She uses it every day and actually enjoys helping around the house now. It's really helpful to have the blank chore magnets to write in different chores. We have tried so many different chore and rewards charts, this is the only one that actually works. The only downside is it can be a little overwhelming. So, we take off all the extra chores and some of the smiley faces and out them in a baggie to the side of the chart.
customer_reviews.author: Val & Sam

customer_reviews.title: I love how easy this is to set up and my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this is to set up and my kids LOVE to put on the faces when they have completed their task. It's definitely helping to motivate them to do things (My kids are 7 and 4). I would say though that we had to go order another one because my kids each wanted to have room to put their faces after they completed the tasks and since it only has room for 7 tasks at a time, I didn't want to have to split those up between themm
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Flexible chore charting
customer_reviews.text: I like this responsibility chart because you can pick the age appropriate chores to add to your chart. It includes chores and attitudes! We have started with 5 areas to work on and will add or replace when those 5 are mastered.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Crunk

customer_reviews.title: It helps
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 4 year old son, who I'm trying to get to be more consistent when it comes to his responsibility around the house like helping out clear the table, putting his toys away and so on. He's been trained to do so without the chart, but I notice that since he's nearing 5 years old, he seem to stray away from his minimal chores, so I bought this to help him get back on track. He likes it and so far it's working. I would change some things about it, like more rows all the way from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: C.Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Why Is This Categorized As A Toy?
customer_reviews.text: The Melissa and Doug brand makes some really nice things. Very high quality and we own quite a few of them. This Responsibility Chart is made just as well. My son isn't overly happy with it but my wife is an organization freak and she thinks it's great. There are enough options so that even the younger children can be structured with it. My son is home schooled and with the two blank goal tabs it fits his day perfectly. After 200 plus reviews I'm not going to linger here so I'll just say I recommend it and think it would be good for most households.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Quality downhill
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous Responsibility Calendar circa 2008. The quality and durability was much better. This 2012 chart came with the wood warped, the laminate covering not extended to the wood and some of the plastic bubbling off the magnetic parts. Usable but disappointed in the quality. I will continue to use the calendar with the knowledge for knowing how well it works for our family. But the quality is surely not what it used to be. Sad to see a company like this cheapen out on their product.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great for my four year old! It is great for helping him to keep track of his daily responsibilities- I love that it is not “chores.” Rates durability low as the board is bowing as some other reviewers noted.
customer_reviews.author: Aislinn Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: This is a really helpful chart and is easy for even young kids to understand. There are 2 blank magnets for you to write on so that you can that you can include a behavior or chore that is more personal to your needs. I deducted 1 star because the magnets are not very strong and the chart itself is quite heavy and when we put it up on the wall it wasn't very stable so we needed to add brackets to the back of it to secure it to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Was so excited...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was very excited about this product. To be honest, our son loves it and is excited to work towards completing each of the tasks/goals for the day, but the quality is less than I expected from Melissa and Doug. The magnet is not strong at all, so some of the pieces slide down or fall off the board completely. The labels on the pieces are nice, but the fact that they don't consistently stay in place is really disappointing. We will keep using it, but I expected more from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Children thrive off of routine. I have a little one that will be four in September and ever since he was born we had a routine every day. As he has gotten older and we have gotten busier we have gotten out of the routine and were all out of whack. So to help the whole family we got this responsibility chart. Jensen is so excited to put all the different magnets on and he also reminds us on busy evening what needs to be done that day. I would definitely recommend this calender for the whole family to stay in routine.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn David

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This chart is simple to use, the board, and magnets are very high quality, and the list of chores and goals are all very helpful and relevant. I love that there are reminder "chores" such as "stop whining" and your child can look at his/her list for daily goals for a little reminder for even the little stuff that they can tend to forget. The price is pretty unbeatable as well. I would highly recommend to any parent looking for cute, organized and fun ways to get your child involved with household daily chores.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia McBride

customer_reviews.title: Ready to organize your household and begin to adopt a healthy routine
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but that’s no surprise for this brand. Empowers children to be responsible and helps them track their chores and progress to hitting their goals. A great tool to adopt a healthy routine. Stress free and ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Jena

customer_reviews.title: Great and fun way of teaching kids how to become responsible
customer_reviews.text: I like this board. It's a fun and self explanatory way of teaching kids how to follow directions and responsibilities. My little boy looks forward to filling the little widgets as well as getting new responsibilities. The only things is that the magnet can be a little slippery and fall. It would be nice of the designers find a way to incorporate a small storage space to save the magnet. But overall, I am very happy with the concept and product and this will be a staple tool for teaching our kids well in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Leilamodel

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for toddlers and up
customer_reviews.text: Pro: good to keep kids glued to it for good behavior brownie points Various titles for kids to get a star for every deed Cons: very cluttery .. magnets can be stronger
customer_reviews.author: sairam konala

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for little ones but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: My main complaint with this is that neither of the boards are completely flat, both bow a bit in the center so sometimes the magnets fall straight off for lack of surface area. That being said my daughter really enjoys it and its easy for her to use, with there were more slots for responsibilities though as my daughter is responsible for more than 7 things over the course of a week (we're talking getting dressed, making bed, feeding pet daily things and cleaning up, trying new things etc.)
customer_reviews.author: A. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Very HELPFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this chart for only about 2 weeks and it has really helped with some of his areas he needs to work on. He loves to do it and some things have already become a habit to him. ] This will even be great when he grows up. Right now he is 5 years old and this chart can grow with him. And I can add my younger son when he is old enough. This chart helped him do things on his own, without me telling him, and that must give him some confidence that he can do things on his own. I would recommend this item to my best friend and know that she would love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Al-Shemmeri

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Chart and so does my child (at the moment). We go over it ever night and if he gets all the smiley faces he gets an extra book at bed time and if he gets a majority of the smiley faces for the week he gets a movie. It teaches him cause and effect of his actions for the day, days of the week, and how to earn rewards that are not in the moment. I just wish there were more blank blocks to write your own stuff on and you can seperate the two boards (too much to play with). Melissa and Doug have great products. Highly recommend, even at 2 1/2 years of age.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: poorly put together
customer_reviews.text: this is such a great idea for a young child. My child is almost 5 and i was excited that this would help her learn responsibility. When we got this we tried to hang it up and the string broke because it is so heavy. Now it is an inconvenient to leave on a table and now we don't use it as much as we would have if it was hanging up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Daignault

customer_reviews.title: Great for lazy children
customer_reviews.text: We use the board to encourage my 7 year old to do chores and be more helpful around the home. She gets ten cents per chore and uses that money to buy herself toys and entertainment. It's a great system and we use the bottom of the board to add a couple other chores. I love this product, I just wish the second board was an extension of the first board and that the pieces were more magnetic so they could be stacked on top of each other.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kay

customer_reviews.title: I order this for my nephew and when I came ...
customer_reviews.text: I order this for my nephew and when I came to visit my sister. I heard my 5 year old nephew said "don't for get to give me a smiley face because I helped aunt kim cook today." He just help me put everything in the pot. I was impressed at how much he was helping out.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: The Best Children's Chore and Character Chart
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these for birthday presents for neighbors kids. The great thing is that it's a character chart, not just a chore chart. It's colorful, tactile and fun for kids. A must have and very affordable gift for every child and their parent!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids on task! Perfect buy!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to get our daughter motivated about daily tasks. It’s working so far, fingers crossed! It’s gives a child a sense of accomplishment and gives them a visual board to help keep them on task throughout the day. It comes with 2 blank magnets to customize, if need be. Definitely a good buy! Highly recommend. It came packaged well and I’m time, as promised. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Motivator!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this chart! My 2 year old is much more helpful/willing to do things when he knows he's going to get a magnet for it. I thought about adding in a monetary bonus so he could get a small toy at the end of the weekend depending on how many magnets he earned, but the fun of getting the magnets and filling up the chart is holding his attention for now. Also, the "chores" they have encompass a good age range. There are plenty of things for my son to do, and my sister just bought one for my 9 year old niece as well. AWESOME product!!
customer_reviews.author: melpark212

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Cute
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my kiddo since we have been slipping on his chore routine. We both love it! He loves all the various options and talked about switching out the chores every once in awhile. He's actually excited by his chart and can't wait to see a smiley face go next to the completed chore. It is a very well made product. This completely blows away the last chore chart I bought him. It was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shanon

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT CHORE BOARD! I LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this chore board! It has really helped teach my 5 year old about chores, routines and responsibility. She does chores without even asking because she wants to earn her happy faces everyday. I love how sturdy the board is, not cheaply made at all. The colors are great, the size is perfect and I like that there is a separate board to hold the other magnets. I'd recommend this board to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: brianna hernandez

customer_reviews.title: It creates habits and happy parents! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with Melissa and Doug products. Our 4 year old loves to complete her daily chores and put her smile face next to each one. It creates habits and happy parents! Highly recommend . Ours is not warped because we attached each side to the wall and took the tension off the fabric connectors. I would like to see the company address that but otherwise a great chart.
customer_reviews.author: PCStevens

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nine-year-old son who has autism and it is perfect 2 showing him the task that he needs to do and he knows he gets a reward after completing a task. His behavioral therapist and teacher are also referring others to using this item. Strongly suggest for all children and the two blank magnet pieces is also amazing
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey moore

customer_reviews.title: It is really easy to use and we keep it right in front ...
customer_reviews.text: This is something I should of got a long time ago. It is really easy to use and we keep it right in front so that our child can see everything she has achieved. its a great motivator for your child. Helps the achieve there goals even faster and with more passion. It is something that i recommend you have if you have kids. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: What is really nice is you can change it as you need to
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my granddaughter for Christmas. Her mother wanted something that she could use for those little duty jobs. What is really nice is you can change it as you need to. While school is on or during summer break. There are plenty of little duties that can be changed as they get a little older. The last time I was at her house for a social get together, several moms asked me where I found it. They too wanted something for their kids and they really liked this one
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Babcock

customer_reviews.title: More then I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son and every night we go through the day and he enjoys putting the magnets next to the responsibility or good behavior. I love that it's not just about responsibilities but good behavior such as "Saying please and thank you" and "No teasing". Each week we change up the list. Only concern is the plastic sheet has became a bit loose and some of the magnets fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Moex

customer_reviews.title: It is fun for him to decide which magnet to put on ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! It is fun for him to decide which magnet to put on after each chore, and I love that I am able to change the chores that are listed. There where several pre-made chores that I thought were a bit odd, but I just put those away. I also wish it came with a few more blank magnets, so be able to customize better, but it does come with two. Overall, it is well made, and has made a big difference for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Stef Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: but this is FANtastic. He could not have been more excited
customer_reviews.text: I NEVER thought I would see my 6 yr old step-son so excited to clean his room or clear the table. We split time with him so we really struggled enforcing chores b/c he doesn't have to do them at his mom's, but this is FANtastic. He could not have been more excited. And now, I cannot be more excited. The magnets are a little weak, but if that's my only issue I'll take it!
customer_reviews.author: BMF

customer_reviews.title: Great item, second one was defective :(
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received one of these for Christmas from her grandparents and we liked it so much that we ordered one for my son. Unfortunately, after opening his up we discovered it was defective, as seen in the photos. The board where the unused magnets are kept is bubbled up across half of it and the magnets fall off in that area. Obviously this isn't the case with all of them, but it is definitely disappointing when one child's is in excellent condition and the other is damaged.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: He loves to pick out what chores he is going to do for the week. And I love that some of the chores are things like "Say please and thank you" or "Keep your hands to yourself". I can remind him throughout the day that he needs to do that to get his smiley.
customer_reviews.author: Mama P

customer_reviews.title: Best investment!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this!! My son is so on top of the chores he’s responsible for. I love that it is inner-changeable because each week seems to be something different that we really need to work on. He is 5, almost 6, and likes the “points” he gets much more than the chores themselves. But it pushes him to get them done.
customer_reviews.author: Tabby McQueen

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Now, you have to discipline yourself as a parent too for this chart to work, but this is a great tool for keeping chores going. We have a weekly treat of some sort for getting all of the magnets, and my daughter loves getting all of her magnets. It makes my life feel much less overwhelming to just have the bed made and the clothes picked up and the table set by someone other than me. The magnets work well, and it has everything that I currently would want on a chart.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: A real motivator
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 6 year old grandson. He looks forward to earning tokens for doing assigned chores.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Such a GREAT idea! I love Melissa & Doug products
customer_reviews.text: Such a GREAT idea! I love Melissa & Doug products, they have amazing ideas. This is great at motivating my daughter to listen and do what we ask and she is excited to put a sticker (as she calls them) on tasks that she completes. My daughter is 3.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Three year old loves it - makes chores fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 3 going on 4, so we don't slave drive him by any means, but I am a big advocate that he can do things for himself little by little. This chart is great because 1) it's sturdy, 2) it gives a spot to make notes on the white board, and 3) the chores range so he can do some now (make bed, sweep, etc) and as he gets older there are more mature chores (walk the dog, take out the trash, etc). Also there are blank ones to write on if you have specifics.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Smith

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug My Magnetic Responsibility Chart
product_meta.description:
Catch children in the act of behaving well, and reward them with a magnet on their hanging chore chart—then watch those good habits multiply Open the fabric-hinged boards to reveal a behavior chart on one board, while the other board keeps all the magnets close at hand. A sturdy cord is attached for hanging it. The set contains a dry-erase board and 90 magnets featuring responsibilities, positive behaviors, and rewards. This kids’ responsibility chart has been developed to help kids develop strong responsibility traits and good behavior. The reward magnets inspire children with positive feedback. The Melissa & Doug Magnetic Responsibility and Chore Chart makes an exceptional gift for kids 3 years and up. Add the Melissa & Doug My First Daily Calendar to round out the hands-on, screen-free play experience. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: MAGNETIC RESPONSIBILITY CHART: The Melissa & Doug Magnetic Responsibility and Chore Chart contains a pair of fabric hinged dry erase boards with 90 magnets featuring behavior and rewards

ENCOURAGES GOOD BEHAVIOR: This kids’ responsibility chart has been designed to help kids develop strong responsibility traits and good behavior. The reward magnets inspire children with positive feedback

PAIR OF FABRIC BOARDS: This Melissa & Doug kids’ routine chart features 2 fabric hinged dry erase boards (one with spaces to track 7 goals, and one that’s blank for magnet storage), along with a sturdy cord for hanging it

GREAT GIFT FOR AGES 3 AND UP: The Melissa & Doug Magnetic Responsibility and Chore Chart makes an exceptional gift for kids 3 years and up. Add the Melissa & Doug My First Daily Calendar to round out the hands on, screen free play experience

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play”

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
